head.title: When the First Stop Is the E.R.

hedline.hl1: When the First Stop Is the E.R.

abstract.p: Maria Camargo letter on Oct 25 article deplores increased reliance on emergency room medical care; drawing

block.p: Re ''Emergency Room, to Many, Remains the Doctor's Office'' (front page, Oct. 25):
Re ''Emergency Room, to Many, Remains the Doctor's Office'' (front page, Oct. 25):

The trend of increased use of the emergency room as a replacement for primary care clinical service will mutate the purpose of an emergency room. Emergency rooms exist to treat immediate and critical health problems.

Identifying, treating and addressing risk factors -- before a disease takes hold and becomes so serious that a patient needs to go to an emergency room -- is key to a healthier population. Preventive care should not be done away with for the convenience of a health care system that doesn't work for the majority of patients.

Since hospitals routinely earn more money from emergency room visits than from clinic visits, they have an incentive to continue this trend. But it is inhumane to make health care a commodity and to let this kind of care continue.
